content: Nvidia's recent blowout earnings affirmed its position as the world's most valuable company, largely due to high sales of GPUs optimized for AI workloads.
The demand for AI inference is growing faster than the demand for AI training, leading to increased interest in smaller, cheaper AI chips.
Major hyperscalers are now designing custom Application-Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) for AI.
Google pioneered custom AI chips with its Tensor Processing Unit (TPU), and other companies like Amazon, Meta, Microsoft, and OpenAI (with Broadcom) have followed suit.
AI chips can be categorized by their application: GPUs for general compute, ASICs for custom cloud AI, and on-device chips for edge AI.
